# toolTip

**Instance Property**

The default text to display in the control’s tooltip.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var toolTip: String? { get set }
```

## Discussion

Set this property to the text that should appear in the tooltip. If you want your app to determine the tooltip text at a later time — for instance, to determine the text based on the current state of your app — set the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIToolTipInteraction/delegate] property of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIControl/toolTipInteraction] after setting [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIControl/toolTip] with the default text. For example, the following code listing sets the tooltip’s default text and delegate for a shopping cart button:

```swift
let button = UIButton(configuration: configuration, primaryAction: action)
button.toolTip = "Click to add the item to your cart. Your cart is empty."
button.toolTipInteraction?.delegate = self
```

If the delegate implements the method [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIToolTipInteractionDelegate/toolTipInteraction(_:configurationAt:)], the tooltip ignores the default text set in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIControl/toolTip] property. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIControl/toolTipInteraction].

## Showing tooltips

- **toolTipInteraction**: The tooltip interaction associated with the control.
